alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Lower Jefferson; Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange; Tyler; Upper Jefferson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 27 at 9:50AM CDT until August 27 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FIRE DANGER CONTINUES FRIDAY... Critically dry fuels will combine with low relative humidity values and gusty winds, especially during the afternoon and near in the vicinity of thunderstorms, to produce an extreme fire danger. Fires will have erratic and explosive growth behavior. Remember burn bans are in effect for the entire area as the severe to exceptional drought conditions continues. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY...VERY DRY FUELS...AND GUSTY WINDS NEAR THUNDERSTORMS FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST TEXAS...AS WELL AS ALL OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA AND PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LOUISIANA... * AFFECTED AREA...Vernon, Rapides, Avoyelles, Beauregard, Allen, Evangeline, St. Landry, Lafayette, Upper St. Martin, Lower St. Martin, West Cameron, East Cameron, Northern Calcasieu, Northern Jefferson Davis, Northern Acadia, Upper Vermilion, Upper Iberia, Upper St. Mary, Tyler, Hardin, Southern Calcasieu, Southern Jefferson Davis, Southern Acadia, Northern Jasper, Northern Newton, Southern Jasper, Southern Newton, Upper Jefferson, Northern Orange, Lower Jefferson and Southern Orange. * TIMING...10 AM until 8 PM Thursday. * WINDS...Northwest around 10 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...105-110. * LIGHTNING...Scattered afternoon thunderstorms possible with lightning that could strike far from the storm center. * IMPACTS...Increased winds and multiple outflow boundaries may change fire direction and could cause fires that develop to spread rapidly. Burn bans are in effect across Louisiana and Southeast Texas.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Hardin; Lower Jefferson; Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Northern Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Southern Orange; Tyler; Upper Jefferson
